types.name: Artefact
types.description:
An Artefact referencing a file defined via a URL.
    Can optionally specify a line range (from - to), and a version.
    Is part of exactly one Trackable.
    Can be referenced by Comments and Issues.
    Artefacts are synced to all IMSProjects of the Trackable they are part of.
    READ is granted if READ is granted on `trackable`.

types.name: Component
types.description:
Entity which represents a software component, e.g. a library, a microservice, or a deployment platform, ....
    The type of software component is defined by the template.
    Can have issues, labels and artefacts as this is a Trackable.
    Defines InterfaceSpecifications, but visible/invisible InterfaceSpecificationVersions depend on the ComponentVersion.
    Can be affected by Issues.
    READ is granted via an associated ComponentPermission or if READ is granted on any Project including any 
    ComponentVersion in `versions` of this Component.

types.name: ComponentPermissionEntry
types.description: ComponentPermission entry enum type.

enumValues.name: ADD_TO_PROJECTS
enumValues.description:
Allows to add the Component to Projects
Note: this should be handled very carefully, as adding a Component to a Project gives
all users with READ access to the Project READ access to the Component

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: Grants all other permissions on the Node except READ.

enumValues.name: COMMENT
enumValues.description:
Allows to create Comments on Issues on this Trackable.
Also allows editing of your own Comments.

enumValues.name: CREATE_ISSUES
enumValues.description:
Allows to create new Issues on the Trackable.
This includes adding Issues from other Trackables.

enumValues.name: EXPORT_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows adding Issues on this Trackable to other Trackables.

enumValues.name: EXPORT_LABELS
enumValues.description: Allows adding Labels on this Trackable to other Trackables.

enumValues.name: LINK_FROM_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows to link **from** Issues on this Trackable to other Issues (on this or other Trackables).

enumValues.name: LINK_TO_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows to link Issues (on this or other Trackables) **to** Issues on this Trackable.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_ARTEFACTS
enumValues.description: Allows to add, remove, and update Artefacts on this Trackable.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_IMS
enumValues.description:
Allows to add, remove, and update IMSProjects on this Trackable.
Note: for adding, `IMSPermissionEntry.SYNC_TRACKABLES` is required additionally

enumValues.name: MANAGE_ISSUES
enumValues.description:
Allows to manage issues.
This includes `CREATE_ISSUES` and `COMMENT`.
This does NOT include `LINK_TO_ISSUES` and `LINK_FROM_ISSUES`.
Additionaly includes
  - change the Template
  - add / remove Labels
  - add / remove Artefacts
  - change any field on the Issue (title, startDate, dueDate, ...)
  - change templated fields
In contrast to `MODERATOR`, this does not allow editing / removing Comments of other users

enumValues.name: MANAGE_LABELS
enumValues.description:
Allows to add, remove, and update Labels on this Trackable.
Also allows to delete a Label, but only if it is allowed on all Trackable the Label is on.

enumValues.name: MODERATOR
enumValues.description:
Allows to moderate Issues on this Trackable.
This allows everything `MANAGE_ISSUES` allows.
Additionally, it allows editing and deleting Comments of other Users

enumValues.name: READ
enumValues.description:
Allows to read the Node (obtain it via the API) and to read certain related Nodes.
See documentation for specific Node for the specific conditions.

enumValues.name: RELATE_FROM_COMPONENT
enumValues.description:
Allows to create Relations with a version of this Component or an Interface of this Component
as start.
Note: as these Relations cannot cause new Interfaces on this Component, this can be granted
more permissively compared to `RELATE_TO_COMPONENT`.

enumValues.name: RELATE_TO_COMPONENT
enumValues.description:
Allows to create Relations with a version of this Component or an Interface of this Component
as end.
Note: this should be handled carefully, as such Relations can result in new Interfaces
on the ComponentVersion.

types.name: GropiusUser
types.description:
A user of the Gropius System.
    The username can be used as unique identifier for GropiusUsers.
    IMSUsers can be linked to a GropiusUser.
    Note however that this link does not affect relationships, e.g. if an IMSUser is part of an Assignment,
    after the IMSUser was linked to a GropiusUser, the GropiusUser does not link directly to the Assignment.
    Therefore, to collect all Assignments, Issue participations etc. it is necessary to also request all 
    linked IMSUsers and their Assignments etc.

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: Assignments the user is part of, this includes assignments which aren't active.

    Can be derived by Relations, and affected by Issues.
    READ is granted if READ is granted on `interfaceSpecification`,
    or any InterfaceDefinition in `definitions`

        Semantically, only the active parts on an InterfaceSpecificationVersion exist on the Interfaces
        defined by the InterfaceSpecificationVersion.

types.name: IntraComponentDependencySpecification
types.description:
Describes a dependency between Interfaces of a Component.
    Both ends can optionally affected InterfaceParts.
    Semantically, any InterfaceSpecification(Version) in `outgoing` depends on any InterfaceSpecification(Version) in 
    `incoming`.
    This can result in a propagation of Issues, if any location in `in` is in some regard affected by an Issue,
    all locations in `out` are affected by this Issue, too.

types.name: Issue
types.description:
An Issue in the Gropius system.
    Issues can be used to report bugs, request features, ask questions, ...
    Issues are synced to all IMSProjects of Trackables they are part of.
    All changes to the Issue are reflected by the timeline.
    READ is granted if READ is granted on any Trackable in `trackables`.

types.name: IssueComment
types.description:
Comment on an Issue.
    Can reference Artefacts.
    Can be deleted, if deleted, the body is set to an empty String and the referencedComments are cleared.
    Keeps track when it was last edited and by who, but does not keep track of the change history.

    RelationTypes for outgoing IssueRelations for Issues with this template.

types.name: ProjectPermissionEntry
types.description: ProjectPermission entry enum type.

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: Grants all other permissions on the Node except READ.

enumValues.name: COMMENT
enumValues.description:
Allows to create Comments on Issues on this Trackable.
Also allows editing of your own Comments.

enumValues.name: CREATE_ISSUES
enumValues.description:
Allows to create new Issues on the Trackable.
This includes adding Issues from other Trackables.

enumValues.name: EXPORT_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows adding Issues on this Trackable to other Trackables.

enumValues.name: EXPORT_LABELS
enumValues.description: Allows adding Labels on this Trackable to other Trackables.

enumValues.name: LINK_FROM_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows to link **from** Issues on this Trackable to other Issues (on this or other Trackables).

enumValues.name: LINK_TO_ISSUES
enumValues.description: Allows to link Issues (on this or other Trackables) **to** Issues on this Trackable.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_ARTEFACTS
enumValues.description: Allows to add, remove, and update Artefacts on this Trackable.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_COMPONENTS
enumValues.description: Allows to add / remove ComponentVersions to / from this Project.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_IMS
enumValues.description:
Allows to add, remove, and update IMSProjects on this Trackable.
Note: for adding, `IMSPermissionEntry.SYNC_TRACKABLES` is required additionally

enumValues.name: MANAGE_ISSUES
enumValues.description:
Allows to manage issues.
This includes `CREATE_ISSUES` and `COMMENT`.
This does NOT include `LINK_TO_ISSUES` and `LINK_FROM_ISSUES`.
Additionaly includes
  - change the Template
  - add / remove Labels
  - add / remove Artefacts
  - change any field on the Issue (title, startDate, dueDate, ...)
  - change templated fields
In contrast to `MODERATOR`, this does not allow editing / removing Comments of other users

enumValues.name: MANAGE_LABELS
enumValues.description:
Allows to add, remove, and update Labels on this Trackable.
Also allows to delete a Label, but only if it is allowed on all Trackable the Label is on.

enumValues.name: MODERATOR
enumValues.description:
Allows to moderate Issues on this Trackable.
This allows everything `MANAGE_ISSUES` allows.
Additionally, it allows editing and deleting Comments of other Users

enumValues.name: READ
enumValues.description:
Allows to read the Node (obtain it via the API) and to read certain related Nodes.
See documentation for specific Node for the specific conditions.

    Relations are always directional.
    The template defines which RelationPartners are possible as start / end.
    For both start and end, if it is an Interface, it is possible to define the InterfaceParts this includes.
    Caution: This is **not** a supertype of IssueRelation.
    READ is granted if READ is granted on `start` or `end`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: StringFilterInput
types.description: Filter which can be used to filter for Nodes with a specific String field

inputFields.name: contains
inputFields.description: Matches Strings which contain the provided value

inputFields.name: endsWith
inputFields.description: Matches Strings which end with the provided value

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Matches values which are equal to the provided value

inputFields.name: gt
inputFields.description: Matches values which are greater than the provided value

inputFields.name: gte
inputFields.description: Matches values which are greater than or equal to the provided value

inputFields.name: in
inputFields.description: Matches values which are equal to any of the provided values

inputFields.name: lt

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

args.name: reason
args.description: The reason for the deprecation

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
